title: No healthcheck for default Agroal datasource if `quarkus.datasource.db-kind` is not set
body:
### Describe the bug

Quarkus allows not setting `quarkus.datasource.db-kind` for the default datasource if there's only one JDBC extension in the classpath; if so, the `db-kind` is inferred automatically.

But when you do that, there is no healthcheck on the default datasource.

This doesn't seem to happen in dev mode, probably because `db-kind` is set by the dev service. It does happen in production.

### Expected behavior

Always have a healthcheck on the default datasource, at least when it's started/used.

### Actual behavior

No healthcheck on the default datasource when `quarkus.datasource.db-kind` is not set.

### How to Reproduce?

Just try with the quickstart: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/hibernate-orm-quickstart

You'll need to add the Smallrye Health extension.

Then build and start in prod:

```
$  curl http://localhost:8080/q/health
{
    "status": "UP",
    "checks": [
        {
            "name": "Database connections health check",
            "status": "UP",
            "data": {
                "<default>": "UP"
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

Then remove `%prod.quarkus.datasource.db-kind=postgresql` from `application.properties`, compile and start again:

```
$  curl http://localhost:8080/q/health
{
    "status": "UP",
    "checks": [
        {
            "name": "Database connections health check",
            "status": "UP"
        }
    ]
}
```

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

The bug is in https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/datasource/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/datasource/runtime/DataSourcesHealthSupportRecorder.java#L20-L22
We assume that a datasource is configured only if its `db-kind` config is set. Which is wrong for the default datasource.
